text: Every person in every neighborhood deserves the opportunity to succeed and we are working to make changes on many fronts—from access to transportation to a comprehensive climate action plan—to make prosperity a reality for all Columbus residents. https://on.nrdc.org/2JULUgo pic.twitter.com/DspMdmPNTm

text:
Columbus wants to increase recycling. 

That could include requiring apartments to recycle at their own cost. 

The latest from a @SustainableCol1 meeting.

text:
Proud that @Columbusgov has been recognized by @CDP as an "A," "Leadership" city in the 2019 CDP Cities report. CDP runs the global environmental disclosure system for businesses & govts. 

This is an improvement from the "B" rating the city received in the previous report. pic.twitter.com/cTDOZjmhEq
text_html: Proud that @Columbusgov has been recognized by @CDP as an "A," "Leadership" city in the 2019 CDP Cities report. CDP runs the global environmental disclosure system for businesses & govts. This is an improvement from the "B" rating the city received in the previous report. pic.twitter.com/cTDOZjmhEq

text:
Recent air monitoring data from the US Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) and Ohio EPA for ground-level ozone shows the Columbus area now meets NAAQS in addition to all other federal air quality standards set to protect public health.
@ColumbusGov #SustainableColumbushttps://twitter.com/SmartCitiesW/status/1166640394584678400 …

text: "City Clean Energy Scorecard" shows how Ohio's 3 big cities stack up on energy efficiency. text:
Join @ColsRecParks on Wednesday, March 4, from 6-8 p.m. at Wyandot Lodge at 3228 Indian Village Road, Cols., for an open house to talk about trees!

The Department is creating the Urban Forestry Master Plan, which will help preserve, maintain and increase our tree canopy. pic.twitter.com/WpKN5mqYPN
text_html: Join @ColsRecParks on Wednesday, March 4, from 6-8 p.m. at Wyandot Lodge at 3228 Indian Village Road, Cols., for an open house to talk about trees! The Department is creating the Urban Forestry Master Plan, which will help preserve, maintain and increase our tree canopy. pic.twitter.com/WpKN5mqYPN

text: Celebrating Sustainable Columbus Successes: The city has seen a 300% increase in illegal dumping case resolutions from 2018 to 2019. Go to https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NUXjBbcSl7I … to learn more about the city's fight. And call (614) 645-3111 if you see illegal dumping.pic.twitter.com/sQVkjdCJ4L
